sentences.english: A presentiment of the future; a foreboding.
sentences.chinese: 他一直有禍事臨頭的預感。

sentences.english: Such a disaster as her car being stolen had never happen before.
sentences.chinese: 有的禍事，像她的車被偷一類，以前從未發生過。

sentences.english: He had a presentiment of trouble coming.
sentences.chinese: 他一直有禍事臨頭的預感。

sentences.english: The ordinary people's lives Let Lin a nowhere, with more heavy calamity.
sentences.chinese: 普通的百姓生活讓林佳一無從適應，更惹出重重禍事。

sentences.english: Blessings cannot simply be expected to come along in disguise.
sentences.chinese: 不能總是指望禍事中隱藏着好事。

sentences.english: Sowhy does it seem like this has been a particularly bad year?
sentences.chinese: 那麼爲什麼在我們看來今年的禍事尤其多呢？

sentences.english: Such a disaster as her car being stolen had never happened before.
sentences.chinese: 有的禍事，像她的汽車被盜之類，以前從未發生過。

definition: no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
the State of Qǐ in modern Qǐ county 杞縣|杞县, Henan (c. 1500-445 BC), a small vassal state of Shang and Western Zhou for most of its existence
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
scramble for power and profit (idiom); power struggle
